content: Justin Rose became the first wire-to-wire winner at Torrey Pines in 71 years, starting with a six-shot lead and closing with a 2-under 70 to win the Farmers Insurance Open.

title: Union Budget 2026: Taxpayers, investors, consumers ‚Äî who gains, who hurts?
content: The Union Budget 2026 aims to balance growth, stability, and reform, offering compliance-friendly measures and targeted tax tweaks for taxpayers. While easing procedures and extending benefits for investors, it also tightens rules in select areas. Consumers receive relief on essential medical items, and businesses benefit from simplified customs, though some duty exemptions are phasing out.

title: ‚ÄòWe know about your mom‚Äô: Mamdani faces heat over Epstein row; supporters heckle NYC mayor at home
content: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani faced voter protests at his home following the release of new Jeffrey Epstein-related documents. These records mention his mother, filmmaker Mira Nair, in connection with a 2009 social event hosted by Ghislaine Maxwell. Protesters expressed anger and disappointment, questioning Mamdani's integrity after having supported him.

title: Ciggies costlier by up to Rs 55/pack after excise hike
content: Cigarette prices have surged by Rs 22-25 per pack of 10 following a new excise duty regime, the first tax hike in seven years. This move aligns India's tobacco taxation with global health standards. Premium cigarettes will see significant price increases, with distributors anticipating new MRPs from Monday. Concerns about smuggling and counterfeit products are rising.

title: What were you doing at 22? Carlos Alcaraz conquers Melbourne
content: Carlos Alcaraz achieved a historic career Grand Slam at 22, defeating Novak Djokovic in a thrilling Australian Open final. Despite a turbulent pre-season, Alcaraz showcased remarkable composure and strategic brilliance, adapting his game to overcome the seasoned champion. His improved serve, influenced by Djokovic himself, proved pivotal in securing the Norman Brookes Challenge Cup.

title: Uttarakhand: Avalanche warning in 5 hill districts after fresh snowfall
content: Avalanche advisories are in effect for five Uttarakhand districts following fresh snowfall in higher regions. Uttarkashi, Chamoli, and Rudraprayag face Danger Level-2, while Pithoragarh and Bageshwar are at Level-1. Residents in snow-bound areas are urged to exercise caution and stay informed about weather updates.

title: IMF data puts India above US in 2026 GDP growth, Elon Musk reacts
content: Elon Musk highlighted a significant global economic shift, noting India's projected contribution to worldwide growth surpassing the United States. This observation aligns with India's robust domestic strength, accelerated manufacturing, and resilient consumer demand, positioning it as a key driver of global expansion alongside China.

title: Dalai Lama wins first Grammy Award for best audio book
content: Spiritual leader the Dalai Lama, aged 90, has received his first Grammy Award for Best Audio Book, Narration, and Storytelling Recording. His album, "Meditations: The Reflections Of His Holiness The Dalai Lama," features his remarks on mindfulness and harmony. He expressed gratitude, viewing the award as recognition of shared responsibility for peace and compassion.

title: Union Budget 2026: Delhi gasps as funds to combat pollution lowered
content: The Union Budget 2026-27 has slashed pollution control funding by Rs 209 crore, sparking criticism amid Delhi-NCR's severe air quality crisis. Experts lament the lack of regional focus and inadequate support for the National Clean Air Programme and EV infrastructure, despite increased clean energy allocations.  This move raises concerns about tackling the escalating public health emergency.

title: Oracle may layoff up to 30,000; one of the reasons is firm's 'commitment'
content: Oracle faces potential job cuts of 20,000-30,000 to fund its massive $156 billion OpenAI partnership. The company has already incurred significant debt for data centers, and rising borrowing costs are stalling projects. OpenAI is reportedly shifting some capacity to Microsoft and Amazon, raising concerns about Oracle's delivery capabilities.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex down over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmarks, opened flat in trade on Monday, a day after 2% crash on Budget‚Äôs hike in STT on futures and options. While Nifty50 went below 24,800, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: Bareilly: Man strangled two months after love marriage; wife, in-laws booked
content: A 33-year-old IVRI employee was found dead, initially reported as suicide but later confirmed as strangulation. Police suspect his wife and her family, citing a dispute over ancestral property and demands for a car and house. The couple had a love marriage two months prior, against their families' wishes.

title: ‚ÄòHum kuch nahi kar sakte‚Äô: Pakistan captain on boycotting India match at T20 World Cup
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha confirmed the team will follow government directives regarding their participation in the T20 World Cup after it was decided they would forfeit their match against India. The Pakistan Cricket Board chairman indicated a final decision would be made soon, with the announcement coming after a meeting with the Prime Minister.

title: Tesla's former Al director Andrej Karpathy posts long note, Elon Musk responds
content: Elon Musk reacted to Andrej Karpathy's observations on Moltbook, an AI agent platform, calling it an early stage of the technological singularity. Karpathy described the platform as a sci-fi takeoff-adjacent phenomenon where AI bots self-organize and interact autonomously, despite acknowledging its current chaotic nature and security risks.

title: T20 World Cup: How India will get a walkover after Pakistan's Feb 15 match boycott
content: Pakistan's surprising decision to boycott their T20 World Cup match against India on February 15th has triggered procedural protocols. India must still attend the venue and be present for the toss. If Pakistan fail to appear, India will be awarded a walkover, securing two points as per ICC regulations. The ICC awaits official confirmation from the PCB.

title: Bishnoi gang claims hit on ISI proxy Shahzad Bhatti in Portugal
content: The Lawrence Bishnoi syndicate claimed responsibility for an attack on alleged ISI henchman Shahzad Bhatti in Portugal, with hooded shooters on a bike reportedly carrying out the operation. This follows a previously undisclosed attempt in Brazil and highlights Bhatti's alleged role in orchestrating terror modules and smuggling operations.

title: In times of turmoil, a healing touch: Cancer drugs, med foods get cheaper in Budget
content: Customs duties on imported medicines for personal use and food for special medical use, have been removed. Duty on imported medicines typically ranges from 5% to 11%. Last year‚Äôs Budget exempted 36 life-saving drugs from basic customs duty. Budget has also proposed strengthening of India‚Äôs drug regulatory and clinical research ecosystem and creation of a national network of 1,000 accredited clinical trial sites.

title: Watson baptized in Israel as Shedeur Sanders meets new Browns HC
content: Cleveland Browns veteran quarterback Deshaun Watson was baptized in Israel, an experience he described as life changing. Meanwhile, new head coach Todd Monken expressed his past desire to draft Shedeur Sanders, highlighting the quarterback‚Äôs significance to the team‚Äôs plans. Cybercitizens react to Watson‚Äôs baptism and Sanders‚Äô special meet with Monken, with one saying, they can‚Äôt wait to see the coach meet Myles Garrett.

title: Turning Point USA reveals platforms for rival Super Bowl halftime show
content: After months of silence, Turning Point USA has finally confirmed how fans can watch its alternative Super Bowl LX halftime show. The broadcast will stream on YouTube, X, Rumble, and several conservative TV networks. While distribution details are now clear, Turning Point USA has not revealed performers or production plans, which still leaves viewers with the question of what they will see when they tune in.

title: Lakers vs Knicks injury report & status: Playing, records and team stats
content: The Los Angeles Lakers face the New York Knicks on February 1, 2026, with both teams battling playoff implications and managing key injuries.  Player availability, particularly for guards like Austin Reaves and Jalen Brunson, will significantly impact rotations and the game's outcome.  The Lakers' scoring prowess will be tested against the Knicks' defensive focus.

title: 68th Grammy Awards: Dalai Lama, K-pop, Spielberg score major wins
content: History was made at the 68th Grammy Awards with the Dalai Lama securing his first win and a K-pop act achieving a historic Grammy. Steven Spielberg earned his first Grammy, becoming an EGOT winner.

title: 'Border 2' box office collection day 10
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' continues its impressive run, crossing Rs 275 crore domestically and Rs 370 crore worldwide by its tenth day. The war drama saw a significant surge over its second weekend, earning Rs 22.5 crore on Sunday despite strong competition, showcasing its enduring box office appeal.

title: FAST, not furious: Amnesty on hidden foreign assets in Budget 2026
content: Under the proposed Foreign Assets of Small Taxpayers ‚Äì Disclosure Scheme, 2026 (FAST-DS 2026), resident taxpayers will get a time-bound opportunity to declare undisclosed foreign income and assets, nearly a decade after the one-time compliance window offered in 2015. A second category covers cases where income was disclosed or tax paid but the foreign asset itself was not declared.

title: Grammy 2026: Kendrick Lamar, Bad Bunny, Lady Gaga score early wins
content: Kendrick Lamar, Bad Bunny, and Lady Gaga are leading the Grammy race, snagging early awards before the main televised event. All three are vying for the coveted Album of the Year award, aiming to make history. The nominations reflect a changing music landscape, with diverse genres and artists gaining prominence.

title: Ram Charan mobbed outside Hyderabad hospital; actor shields daughter Klin Kaara
content: Actor Ram Charan faced a distressing situation outside a Hyderabad hospital when a mob surrounded him and his young daughter, Klin Kaara. The overwhelming crowd, eager for a glimpse, created a chaotic and unsafe environment, leaving the child visibly scared. This incident sparked widespread anger online, with many condemning the fans' reckless behavior and prioritizing a child's safety.

title: Epstein row: Elon Musk denies links; rejects ‚Äòcreepy island‚Äô and ‚ÄòLolita Express‚Äô claims
content: Tech billionaire Elon Musk has denied any connection to Jeffrey Epstein. Musk stated he never visited Epstein's island, attended his parties, or flew on his plane. His denial comes after his name surfaced in recently released Epstein case documents. Musk emphasized his support for full document disclosure and prosecution of abusers, even if it leads to personal attacks.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for this week - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: According to Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd, the top stock picks for the trading week (starting February 2, 2026) are ICICI Bank, and APL Apollo Tubes. Let‚Äôs take a look:

title: Grammys 2026: Ros√© becomes first K-Pop soloist to open the show
content: Ros√© made history at the Grammy Awards 2026, opening the show with Bruno Mars and becoming the first K-pop solo artist to perform. Their energetic rendition of "APT" captivated audiences, sparking widespread fan praise and social media buzz. Beyond her groundbreaking performance, Ros√© also earned three major nominations, marking a significant milestone for K-pop in general field categories.

title: After 'ek rupiya bhi nahi kamaya' remarks, Mary Kom issues apology video ‚Äî Watch
content: Mary Kom released a clarification video apologising for remarks that sparked backlash, saying they were misunderstood and not meant to offend. She addressed speculation around her marriage and divorce, denied targeting football or any community, and called her comments an emotional outburst. Amid public allegations between her and ex-husband Onler, she urged restraint, dignity, and continued support as she remains committed to Indian boxing.

title: Budget 2026: Filing returns? Don‚Äôt sweat I-T, says Nirmala Sitharaman
content: ‚Äã‚ÄãThe redesigned income tax return forms will be notified shortly, with the govt promising simpler language and layouts that allow ordinary taxpayers to comply without professional assistance. The FM said the time limit for filing a revised tax return was being extended from nine months to 12 months after the end of the tax year, leaving enough room to fix mistakes without staring at a penalty.

title: Pakistan to boycott India at T20 WC: How the events unfolded - a timeline
content: Pakistan government has announced that their cricket team will not play India in the group stage contest of the T20 World Cup. The government did allow the team to travel to Sri Lanka for their matches. A look at the sequence of events that led to this decision.

title: Rashmika Mandanna says no Feb 2 wedding with Vijay Deverakonda‚ÄîReports
content: Rumours of Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's February 2 wedding in Udaipur have been reportedly denied by Rashmika. While an influencer's viral video fueled speculation, new reports suggest a private ceremony might take place on February 26. A grand reception in Hyderabad is anticipated later, with the couple previously keeping wedding plans private.

title: No tax cuts, FM tries to ease life for taxpayers in 2026 Budget
content: The Finance Minister has eased tax burdens for citizens, particularly those with children studying abroad or seeking overseas medical treatment, by reducing the Tax Collected at Source (TCS) from 5% to 2%. This move also significantly lowers TCS on international tour packages, boosting outbound tourism by freeing up traveler liquidity and reducing upfront cash outlays.

title: MLB trade rumors: Dodgers linked to $400mn Cy Young deal with Tigers
content: A potential trade between the Los Angeles Dodgers and Detroit Tigers involves Roki Sasaki for Tarik Skubal. This hypothetical deal highlights the Dodgers' focus on immediate championship contention and the Tigers' long-term roster development. The exchange would significantly alter both pitching staffs, with the Dodgers gaining a proven starter and the Tigers acquiring a young arm with future control.

title: ‚ÄòHum hain na,‚Äô PM Modi assures followers of Guru Ravidas
content: PM Modi addressed the followers at Dera Sachkhand Ballan soon after naming Adampur airport after the social reformer on his birth anniversary, lauding his message of equality. ‚ÄúI am confident that we will continue to strengthen the roots of our society with these efforts,‚Äù he said in a message of unity to the poet-saint‚Äôs followers. His inclusion of Ravidas in the saffron tent of its lodestars, where Lord Ram sits alongside revered saints, is being seen as his effort to deepen BJP‚Äôs connect and broaden its cultural appeal.

title: D-St blues! Sensex sheds 1.5K, biggest drop on a Budget day
content: The day‚Äôs trading was marked by high volatility. The sensex rallied over 400 points as FM started her speech, fell about 1,100 points after the STT hike proposal was announced, partially recovered by mid-session to trade 600 points down on the day and then sold-off to close below the 81K mark for the first time in four months.

title: Budget earmarks 500cr first tranche of 5,000cr Ulfa deal
content: Ulfa has submitted a list of 36 projects, spanning education, transport infrastructure, sports, wetlands and initiatives under Centre‚Äôs Act East policy. The proposals include making Assam a green energy hub, establishing an IISER, and setting up an IIM in Guwahati, with the last one already underway. One faction ‚Äî Ulfa (Independent) ‚Äî remains outside the settlement.

title: STT shock jolts markets, sensex spirals to worst Budget Day loss in points
content: The day‚Äôs trading was marked by high volatility. The sensex rallied over 400 points as FM started her speech, fell about 1,100 points after the STT hike proposal was announced, partially recovered by mid-session to trade 600 points down on the day and then dropped again to close below the 81k mark for the first time in four months.

title: Top US-India Industry Bodies Cheer Union Budget 2026, Call For Faster Executions
content: Two of the most influential US-India industry bodies have strongly welcomed the Union Budget 2026-27, calling it a forward-looking fiscal blueprint that strengthens India's position as a global investment hub while deepening economic ties with the US

title: "Victory Is Certain": Vijay's Message On TVK's 3rd Anniversary Ahead Of Tamil Nadu Polls
content: In a letter addressed to party cadre, released hours ahead of his address at the TVK headquarters, Vijay called upon his supporters to move towards "political recognition through clarity, strategy and dedication."

title: Women 'Fidayeens', IED Attacks: How Baloch Rebels Killed '200 Pakistan Personnel'
content: The Baloch rebel group Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) has claimed that its ongoing offensive, dubbed Operation Herof Phase II, has continued for more than 40 hours across several districts of Balochistan.

title: "Felt Sick To My Stomach": Bryan Johnson On Call With Jeffrey Epstein 8 Years Ago
content: At the time of the call, Bryan Johnson said he had no knowledge of Epstein's criminal history or the allegations that would later emerge.

title: Gold Falls 1.5%, Silver Rises 1.6% After Over 3-Week Low
content: Gold extended falls on Monday, pressured by a firm dollar, as investors gauged US President Donald Trump's Fed chair pick Kevin Warsh's approach to interest rate cuts, while silver recovered from a more than three-week low hit on Friday.

title: Nvidia CEO Denies Being "Unhappy" With OpenAI, Reaffirms Plans For Investment
content: Nvidia plans to make a "huge" investment into OpenAI, probably its largest ever, CEO Jensen Huang said on Saturday, denying he was unhappy with the ChatGPT maker.

title: Parliament Budget Session 2026¬†Live: Lok Sabha To Debate On President's Address Today, 18-Hour Discussion Scheduled
content: Budget Session of Parliament¬†2026 Live Updates: The Lok Sabha is set to begin today with discussions on the President Droupadi Murmu's address, a day after finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented her ninth Union Budget in the Lok Sabha.

title: Delhi-NCR Wakes Up To Thick Blanket Of Fog, Air Quality Remains Poor
content: Several parts of the national capital woke up to dense fog on Monday morning, with the Air Quality Index (AQI) remaining in the moderate to poor categories according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) data.

title: Cement-Coated Fennel, Brand Name: How 3 Businessmen Sold Adulterated Cumin
content: Police have registered a First Information Report (FIR) against three businessmen accused of manufacturing and trafficking fake cumin under the popular Shivpujari brand name.

title: Apartment Prices Have Risen Every Single Week For A Year In This City
content: Seoul's population of 9.3 million exceeds the number of people living in New York City in a space that's about 75% the size of the American city.

title: US Cops Shot During Investigation At Hotel, 1 Dead, 1 Injured
content: A man being questioned by police at a suburban Atlanta hotel on Sunday shot the two officers after inviting them into his room, killing one of them and seriously wounding the other, authorities said.

title: US Partial Shutdown May End On Tuesday. How It Differs From Full Cease
content: The partial government shutdown is vastly different from the record closure in the fall. That is mostly because this shutdown, which started Saturday, does not include the whole of government and may not last long

title: 'Deflecting': India Rejects Pakistan's "Frivolous" Claims On Balochistan Attacks
content: India has rejected Pakistan's "baseless" allegations linking the recent attacks in Balochistan, which killed dozens, with India.

content: Time and again, Donald Trump has proven that he possesses the best words. They just aren't always the ones in the dictionary.

title: Earthquake Of 4.6 Magnitude Strikes Andaman And Nicobar Islands
content: An earthquake of magnitude 4.6 struck the Andaman and Nicobar Islands on Monday at about 3.30 am, a statement by the National Center of Seismology (NCS) said.

title: Ex-UK Ambassador Peter Mandelson Quits Labour Party Amid Scrutiny Over Epstein Links
content: Former British ambassador to Washington Peter Mandelson quit the Labour Party Sunday, seeking to avoid causing it "further embarrassment" after newly released US documents revived scrutiny of his connection to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: "Of Course He Will Say That": Trump On Khamenei's 'Regional War' Threat
content: US President Donald Trump on Sunday said he was hopeful of agreeing a deal with Iran after the country's supreme leader warned that any US attack on the Islamic republic would trigger a regional war.

title: 5-Year-Old Arrested By ICE Agents In Minnesota Released After Judge's Order
content: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father, who were detained by immigration officers in Minnesota and held at an ICE facility in Texas, have been released following a judge's order. They have returned to Minnesota

title: Pak Forces Kill 145 In Balochistan In 2-Day Battle After 'Coordinated' Attacks
content: Pakistani security forces killed 145 militants in a 40-hour battle launched as a series of coordinated gun and bomb attacks across Balochistan left nearly 50 people dead, the province's chief minister said on Sunday.

title: Kennedy Centre To Be Closed For 2 Years For Renovation, Orders Trump
content: President Donald Trump said Sunday he will move to close Washington's Kennedy Center performing arts center for two years starting in July for construction, his latest move to upturn the storied venue since returning to the White House.

title: Shaun White's next act? Revolutionizing snowboardi...
content: SHAUN WHITE, 39, has seen himself in a snowboard bib since he last competed at the 2022 Beijing winter Olympics . he will take a ceremonial run through the Buttermilk Mountain halfpipe to open the March 2025 contest that has brought him to town .

title: Prince Andrew should testify before US Congress panel over Epstein ties: Keir Starmer
content: former prince Andrew should testify before a congressional committee . new files related to Epstein published by the justice department on friday included emails that showed his brother maintaining regular contact with Epstein for more than two years . the files also include pictures appearing to show Andrew crouching over and touching the waist of an unidentified woman lying on the floor .

title: 4.7 magnitude earthquake hits J&K's Baramulla
content: NEW DELHI: An earthquake of intensity 4.7 hit Baramulla in Jammu and Kashmir at 5.35 am, Monday. According to the National Centre of Seismology, the earthquake was recorded at a depth of 10km. The epicentre was reported to be in the Pattan area, according to PTI. The tremors were felt in India and Pakistan. The epicentral area, as described by NCS, was using reference points close to Gulmarg and west of Srinagar. The location was also described as about 84 km west of Pahalgam and roughly 164 km west-southwest of Kargil, indicating a broader regional context across the valley and adjoining high-altitude areas. While no immediate signs of damage have been reported yet, videos shared on social media show the intensity of the tremors captured in the CCTV cameras.

content: The earlier rules did not affect Apple‚Äôs South Korean rival Samsung as almost all of ‚Å†its phones are made in its own Indian factories, and not by contract manufacturers

title: Government raises limit for bringing duty-free imported goods to ‚Çπ75,000 under new baggage rules
content: Under the Baggage Rules, 2026, a resident or a tourist of Indian origin arriving in India other than by land, shall be allowed clearance free of duty articles, up to ‚Çπ75,000, if such articles are carried on the person or in the bona fide accompanied baggage of the passenger

content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke about the efforts that are being made to ensure a ‚Äúbetter India‚Äù for students while drawing a contrast with the India she grew up in

title: Assam government accused of letting corporate houses take over tribal lands
content: Political parties and social organisations in Dima Hasao district cite the allotment of more than 9,000 bighas of land for limestone mining to feed cement plants and a proposed mega hydropower project

title: Union Budget 2026 falls short of expectations in poll-bound West Bengal
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the Budget had nothing to offer to people of the State. The Bharatiya Janata Party  (BJP) leadership said that the infrastructure push through rail and freight corridors will push economy of the State.

title: Himachal CM Sukhu terms Union Budget ‚Äòinequitable‚Äô, raises concerns over Finance Commission report
content: Himachal Pradesh CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu said the Budget overlooked the concerns and priorities of Himachal Pradesh, even as he raised serious concerns regarding the recently tabled 16th¬†Finance Commission

title: Union Budget an inspiring blueprint for building ‚ÄòViksit Bharat‚Äô, says U.P. CM
content: Budget will provide opportunities to the youth, security to farmers, encouragement to entrepreneurs, relief to the middle class, respect to workers, and new impetus for innovation, says Adityanath

title: Activists express concerns over Odisha government turning a blind eye to depletion of mineral resources
content: The government is facilitating mineral extraction by large corporate houses without taking a long-term view of resource sustainability, says Lingaraj, a prominent rights activist

title: Srinagar youth provide¬†brave new voice amid silence, despair: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Scores of girls also attended the PDP initiative and highlighted the issues the new generation was facing when it comes to employment and political aspirations. The meeting was held in the old city‚Äôs Babademb¬†area.

title: Mamata Banerjee to meet CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: The Chief Minister has written six letters to the Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar on the issue of SIR over the past few months. In the last letter dated January 31, Ms. Banerjee said that SIR has resulted in as many as 140 deaths and was being carried out in blatant disregard of human rights and humanitarian considerations

title: National Fibre scheme to integrate various schemes for natural and man-made fibres under Textiles Ministry
content: ‚ÄòWe are aiming to double the country‚Äôs textile value chain from the existing $170 billion to $350 billion by 2030,‚Äô P. Sivakumar says

title: Nearing one year of President‚Äôs Rule in Manipur, BJP MLAs and alliance partners called to Delhi for meeting
content: Members of Legislative Assembly (MLA) from both Kuki-Zo and Meitei communities were headed to New Delhi to attend the meeting

title: State Highways Dept. commences work on bridge across Palar river
content: The ‚Çπ17.65-crore high-level bridge across Viruthasiri river is expected to benefit residents of at least 28 surrounding villages

title: Budget 2026 moots several proposals to rejuvenate indigenous shipping
content: In today‚Äôs speech, the Finance Minister spoke about the government‚Äôs aim to develop inland and coastal shipping so that its share in total cargo carried through road, rail and water increases from 6% to 12%

title: Union Budget 2026: Marginal hike in allocations for Social Justice Dept., Tribal Affairs Ministry
content: The Social Justice Department‚Äôs allocation for 2026-27 is ‚Çπ13,687.59 crore and the Tribal Affairs Ministry has been allocated ‚Çπ15,421.97 crore; the allocations have increased by 16.69% and 42.47% respectively compared with their respective Revised Estimates for the current fiscal

title: Kerala for All conclave: State told to cater to neuro-inclusive travel
content: On its part, Kerala must introduce an inclusive-destination certification scheme like in the West, which ought to be highlighted in the respective websites

title: Two men who opposed harassment of Muslim shopkeeper booked in Uttarakhand
content: FIR lodged against members of right-wing groups who blocked a national highway to express anger over the intervention of Deepak Kumar and Vijay Rawat

title: Watch: Union Budget proposals spark political debate ahead of West Bengal polls
content: Infrastructure proposals in the Union Budget, including freight and industrial corridors and tourism projects, have triggered a political clash in West Bengal ahead of Assembly elections, with the BJP pitching development and the TMC calling the announcements political signalling.

title: Praful Patel denies Piyush Goyal‚Äôs claim that he has been appointed NCP chief
content: ‚ÄúCompletely baseless,‚Äù says Mr. Patel; Mr. Goyal later apologises; CM Devendra Fadnavis refutes Sharad Pawar‚Äôs claims of an NCP merger; DCM Sunetra Pawar reaches Baramati for Ajit Pawar‚Äôs last rites

title: Union Budget 2026: Agri Ministry allocation up 2.6%; farm outfits say FM ignored their demands
content: No hike for Kisan Samman Nidhi; agri research and education budget drops 4.8%; Food and PDS gets 10% hike; new multilingual AI tool, high-value cash crops get extra support; government did not fulfil promises to farmers, says BKS

title: 'Tired, broken, dilapidated': Trump announces 2-year shutdown of Kennedy Center
content: File photo At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: If merger talks were on, Ajitdada would have told us: CM Fadnavis
content: CM Devendra Fadnavis said they had no idea about the merger . he said if discussions had gone to a final stage, he would have informed us . the CM's statement came a day after chief Sharad Pawar claimed that Feb 12 had been finalised to announce a merger between the two factions .

title: Union Budget: FM reaches for the stars, boosts astronomy research
content: Determine the monthly installment amount for a loan Estimate the returns on investments made through SIPs Find out maturity amount and interest earned on PPF Check maturity amount and interest earned on an FD Estimate the pension amount and corpus accumulated under NPS A Mutual Fund Calculator helps estimate the future value of investments

title: Sources: Cards set to hire Rams' LaFleur as HC
content: the Arizona Cardinals have hired Mike LaFleur as their new head coach . he is expected to become the Raiders' head coach after the super bowl . sources say the team pivoted to another offensive coordinator in the NFC West .

title: NBA buzz: Live updates, trades and intel from arou...
content: the deadline for a Giannis Antetokounmpo trade is at 3 p.m. ET on friday . the move from the Atlanta Hawks to the Washington Wizards kicks off trade season . there should be more drama ahead of the deadline .

title: Address ‚Äòlongstanding demands‚Äô of Baloch people, India tells Pakistan
content: The remarks from the official spokesperson of the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) came after Pakistan‚Äôs Interior Minister Mohsin Raza Naqvi alleged that the latest attacks were carried out with help from India

title: Trade bodies say Budget powers MSMEs, provides boost to domestic manufacturing and further simplifies doing business
content: A growth-oriented and sector-enabling Budget for micro and small scale industries that balances capital infusion, infrastructure expansion and proposes¬†cluster modernisation, and policy reform to support global competitiveness and sustainable employment generation in the MSE sector

title: CM remembers Sri Siddaramanand Puri Swami for his spirituality, secularism
content: He was addressing a gathering at a tribute function got up for the late swamiji at Tinthini Bridge in Deodurg taluk of Raichur district

title: Files expose alleged links between Epstein, Anil Ambani and Delhi ‚Äòleadership‚Äô
content: Anil Ambani appears to have met with Epstein on May 23, 2019, following which Epstein messaged Steve Bannon that he had met Prime Minister Modi‚Äôs ‚Äúguy‚Äù

title: A budget for difficult times
content: Union Budget sets Centre‚Äôs capital expenditure target at ‚Çπ12.2 lakh crore; India must stay deeply integrated with global markets, attracting stable long-term investment, says Finance Minister

title: Union Budget 2026 does little to reduce out-of-pocket expenses, medical inflation: experts
content: While exempting 17 cancer medicines from basic customs duty was welcome, there is little evidence to suggest that companies passed on the benefit to the customers in earlier instances

title: Karnataka is set to lose about ‚Çπ10,000 crore to ‚Çπ15,000 crore due to 16th FC‚Äôs recommendation, says Siddaramaiah
content: ‚ÄúWhen Karnataka‚Äôs share in the divisible pool of central taxes fell from 4.71% under the 14th Finance Commission to 3.64% under the 15th Finance Commission, the estimated loss was over 23% in revenue,‚Äù he pointed out.

title: Budget draws mixed reactions from common people
content: While some say Budget aligns with long-term vision of Viksit Bharat 2047, some express concerns about implementation of proposed initiatives and highlight unaddressed gaps in scholarships, education loans, teacher upskilling and campus-level mental health support

title: BRS cadre stage protests across Telangana against SIT examination of KCR
content: Police prevent different forms of protests at various places; Party ranks scuffle with police at Telangana Bhavan

title: Budget 2026: Govt. plans employment boost through tourism sector with upskilling of guides, Buddhist circuit in Northeast
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also said that a National Destination Digital Knowledge Grid to digitally document all places of cultural, spiritual and historic significance would be set up

title: Tadoba‚Äôs tiger swims two rivers, kills three cattle in A.P.
content: The Male tiger had moved via the Polavaram Irrigation project before swimming the river Godavari to enter into human habitations in search of prey.

title: Industry forums in Kerala welcome development proposals in Union Budget
content: The FICCI and the Indian Chamber of Commerce & Industry, Cochin, praised initiatives aimed at bolstering manufacturing, with significant funding for bio-pharma and electronic components.

title: Union Budget 2026: Jammu and Kashmir fund allocation ‚Äòmarginally‚Äô up; Ladakh sees around 27% increase
content: ‚ÄúThe modest increase of ‚Çπ2,000 crore in Central allocations falls far short of addressing the region‚Äôs long-standing developmental gap or providing the stimulus required for revival of existing industrial units,‚Äù says FCIK

title: YSRCP leader Ambati Rambabu held for 19 hours in police custody
content: The Guntur police detained the former Minister from Saturday night till Sunday evening in connection with alleged derogatory remarks against Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu and disruption of police duties

title: SSLC examinations to be held from March 5 to 30; results on May 8
content: The SSLC IT examinations will be held from February 2 to 13, while model examinations are scheduled from February 16 and 20

title: Progressive in intent but short on immediate relief: Hyderabadis
content: While the emphasis on long-term economic growth, infrastructure spending and fiscal discipline has found support, the absence of changes to income tax slabs or the standard deduction has left many salaried taxpayers disappointed

title: UDF will come to power in Kerala after Assembly polls, says Thangal
content: Thangal also alleged that the State government had been taking a hostile attitude towards protests by labour unions and cited the example of the strike by Accredited Social Health Activists

title: Union Budget disappointing: K.N. Balagopal
content: On picking Kerala for the ‚ÄòRare Earth Corridor‚Äô scheme, Mr. Balagopal said that the State‚Äôs aim was to have related industries established in Kerala.

title: Jagan condemns attacks on YSRCP leaders, alleges collapse of law and order in Andhra Pradesh
content: YSR Congress Party chief speaks to injured leaders, accuses TDP government of vindictive politics and police misuse as tension erupts after attacks on party leaders‚Äô residences

title: Budget proposes high-speed rail links to Bengaluru; rail activists flag lack of clarity
content: The announcement has been welcomed by rail activists and urban mobility experts, though they remain cautious about the timeline and execution of the ambitious proposal.

title: Delay in sanction for new tank at  Thammanam likely to worsen water crisis in Kochi
content: The Kerala Water Authority had earlier submitted the design for a new 35-lakh-litre tank at Thammanam to address the shortage, but, according to sources, the proposal is still awaiting administrative sanction

title: Suspected TDP activists attack Jogi Ramesh‚Äôs house in Ibrahimpatnam

content: Uncertainty over Central assistance for major infra projects forces the State to explore alternatives
